intro: Huntleya sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved huntleya, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking, often bright-colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its linear, sessile leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as sandy plains and rocky outcrops. Huntleya sessiliflora is a hardy species that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native range.
